intro: Picria, commonly known as goat's beard, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. These plants are characterized by their finely divided, feather-like leaves and small, yellowish flowers that often form umbrella-shaped clusters. They are native to various regions across Europe, Asia, and Africa, and many species are found in arid or semi-arid environments. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Picria plants typically grow from herbaceous perennials to annuals, depending on the species and environmental conditions.
